title: Honey Ginger Peach Sauce for Grilled Chicken
ingredients: 4 medium peaches, peeled and pitted, or 2 cups frozen and defrosted peaches
instructions: Cut 3 of the peaches (or 1½ cups frozen peaches) into large chunks.  In a blender of food processor, purée all ingredients until smooth.  Pour the mixture into a small sauce pan.  Bring to a boil then reduce the heat and simmer uncovered 15 minutes or until slightly thickened, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, finely chop remaining peaches (or remaining ½ cup frozen peaches.)  Stir them into the sauce.  Pour the sauce into a glass jar, seal tightly, and refrigerate until you’re ready to use it.
Brush onto the chicken in the last minutes of grilling.
source: Adapted from Weber’s Art of the Grill, (Included in:  There’s More to Grilling Chicken than a Spice Rub and Hot Coals article by Tina Danze), Texas Taste Section, The Dallas Morning News, Wednesday, May 22, 2002.
